NightWalker
Developed by The Guardians (TA16)
Build a sense of safety while walking at night.

CityWalker is an application designed for people walking alone in the City of Melbourne at night feeling unsafe. Users can use it to check the road situation before they walk alone at night and gain emergency support by calling their emergency contact or sending the current location to the emergency contact if an emergency happens during walking. To be prepared better, users can see some safety tips before walking.

When you input the starting point and destination, the routes and icons along the routes will be displayed. Each colour of the icons represents a safety factor and you can click it for more information. For the pedestrian counting system sensors, the latest reading of the sensor and the busyness degree from prediction are provided by clicking the corresponding icons. The currently highlighted route is the safest among the displayed routes with the highest safety scores showing in the bottom sheet. Select different routes on the map to see the differences and check the hidden part of the bottom sheet for the exact number of all safety factors along the selected routes. Currently, our application supports police stations, 24-hour open stores and restaurants, CCTV cameras and pedestrian counting system sensors as the safety factors.

Don’t forget to update your emergency contact in our application before you go. When you walking alone, you can click the red short-cut buttons on the main page or the Emergency Support page to call your emergency or send an emergency message starting with ‘HELP ME!’ with your current location information to him/her. Besides, you can also share your location in non-emergency time by clicking the blue location sharing button. Moreover, navigation to a safe place can find the nearest police station or 24-hour open stores around you and show the directions to you by one click.
Some normal but easily missed safety tips are shown in the safety tip cards with cartoon images. Slide them to see to achieve confidence before walking alone at night.

The busyness degree of each sensor is defined based on the prediction of total counts of the pedestrian at the current hour. With the history records of hourly readings of Pedestrian Counting System from May 2009 to March 2019, a Neural Network model is built to predict the total counts of specific sensors in particular hours of each day.
• When the prediction of the specific hour is less than 600 - Usually not busy
• When the prediction of the specific hour is between 600 and 1799 - Usually not too busy
• When the prediction of the specific hour is between 1800 and 2999 - Usually a little busy
• When the prediction of the specific hour is more than 2999 - Usually busy

The safest route among all suggested routes is provided by comparing the safety scores of all routes. The safety score is calculated based on the distance of the route and the quantities of safety factors (CCTV cameras, 24-hour open stores and police stations) along the routes, which means the more safety factors it has per meter, the higher safety score the route would have.

We collect information to provide better services to all our users and we respect the rights to privacy of everyone. The information we collect will never be published, sharing, abused or suffer any other forms of privacy violation from us. The locations of our users are collected and used only in the following situations:
• When users use their current location as the starting point or destination in Route Check
• When users send emergency messages or location sharing messages which contain the current location coordinates of users in Emergency Support; And
• When users click the buttons of navigation to a safe place in Emergency Support and the current location is set as the starting point.
The names and phone numbers of emergency contact of our users are collected, stored in the local databases in users’ phones and used only in the following situations:
• When users use their current location as the starting point or destination in Route Check
• When users send emergency messages or location sharing messages to their emergency contact in Emergency Support
• When users call their emergency contact in Emergency Support.

By using our application, you agree that our application only provides suggestions based on analysing data and information from the government or organizations. In case of any discrepancy or inconsistency between the actual conditions and the information from our application, the actual conditions shall prevail.
